title: How to Rip DVD Audio to MP3 Using VLC Media Player

steps.title: Insert the DVD into your computer's DVD drive.
steps.content: Insert the DVD into your computer's DVD drive. The DVD should go logo-side-up. If your computer has a CD drive instead of a DVD drive, you may not be able to rip the DVD's audio. You can ensure that you have a DVD drive by looking for the "DVD" logo on the drive's tray. If you either don't have a DVD drive or don't have a space for your disc at all, you'll need to use an external USB DVD drive.

steps.title: Open VLC.
steps.content: Open VLC. Its app icon resembles an orange-and-white traffic cone.

steps.title: Click Media.
steps.content: Click Media . It's a tab in the top-left corner of the VLC window. A drop-down menu will appear. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click Open Disc….
steps.content: Click Open Disc… . You'll find this option in the drop-down menu. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Check the "No disc menus" box.
steps.content: Check the "No disc menus" box. It's in the upper-left side of the window.

steps.title: Click .
steps.content: Click . This icon is at the bottom of the window, to the right of the Play button. Clicking it prompts a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Convert.
steps.content: Click Convert . It's in the drop-down menu. This will open a new page. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Change the output file type to MP3.
steps.content: Change the output file type to MP3. Click the "Profile" drop-down box, then click Audio - MP3 in the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Browse.
steps.content: Click Browse . It's in the lower-right side of the window. Doing so opens a pop-up window. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Enter a file name.
steps.content: Enter a file name. In the "File name" text box, type in whatever you want to name your ripped DVD file. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Select a save location.
steps.content: Select a save location. Click a folder in the left-hand sidebar to select it as the save location for your MP3 file.

steps.title: Click Save.
steps.content: Click Save . It's in the bottom-right corner of the window.

steps.title: Click Start.
steps.content: Click Start . This option is at the bottom of the window. Your DVD will begin ripping. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Allow your DVD to rip.
steps.content: Allow your DVD to rip. Depending on the DVD's size, this can take anywhere from half an hour to well over an hour. Once VLC finishes ripping your DVD, the completed MP3 file will be in your selected save location. If prompted, click Keep to prevent your MP3 file from getting overwritten.

steps.title: Insert your DVD into your Mac's DVD player.
steps.content: Insert your DVD into your Mac's DVD player. The DVD should go logo-side-up. Since most Macs don't ship with DVD drives included, you'll probably need an external USB DVD drive to plug into your Mac.

steps.title: Open VLC.
steps.content: Open VLC. Click Spotlight , type in vlc , and double-click the VLC result, then click Open when prompted.

steps.title: Click File.
steps.content: Click File . This menu item is in the top-left corner of your Mac's screen.

steps.title: Click Open Disc….
steps.content: Click Open Disc… . It's in the File drop-down menu. Doing so will open a settings window with your DVD's information.

steps.title: Click Disable DVD menus.
steps.content: Click Disable DVD menus . This button is in the upper-right side of the window.

steps.title: Check the "Stream output" box.
steps.content: Check the "Stream output" box. This option is in the bottom-left corner of the window.

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . It's on the right side of the window. Your video's conversion settings will open.

steps.title: Check the "File" box.
steps.content: Check the "File" box. This option is at the top of the page. If both "File" and "Stream" are checked, click the "File" checkbox again to make sure it's the only output.

steps.title: Click Browse….
steps.content: Click Browse… . It's in the upper-right side of the window. A pop-up window will open.

steps.title: Enter a name.
steps.content: Enter a name. Type a name for your DVD file into the "Save As" text box, then type in .mp3 after the name. If you want to name your MP3 file "The Blair Witch Project", for example, you would type in The Blair Witch Project.mp3 here.

steps.title: Select a save location.
steps.content: Select a save location. Click the "Where" drop-down box, then click a folder (e.g., Desktop ) in the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Save.
steps.content: Click Save . It's at the bottom of the window.

steps.title: Uncheck the "Video" box.
steps.content: Uncheck the "Video" box. This is in the middle of the page.

steps.title: Indicate that you want to include audio.
steps.content: Indicate that you want to include audio. Check the "Audio" box, then click the "Audio" drop-down box and click MP3 in the resulting menu.

steps.title: Click OK twice.
steps.content: Click OK twice. Doing so prompts VLC to begin ripping your DVD into an MP3 file.

steps.title: Allow your DVD to rip.
steps.content: Allow your DVD to rip. Depending on the DVD's size, this can take anywhere from half an hour to well over an hour. Once VLC finishes ripping your DVD, the completed MP3 file will be in your selected save location. If prompted, click Keep to prevent your MP3 file from getting overwritten.

steps.title: Download and install HandBrake.
steps.content: Download and install HandBrake. HandBrake is a free program for Windows and Mac computers that can be used to rip an MP4 file from a DVD: Go to https://handbrake.fr/ in your computer's web browser. [7] X Research source Click Download HandBrake . Double-click the downloaded setup file. Follow the on-screen instructions.

steps.title: Insert the DVD into your computer's DVD drive.
steps.content: Insert the DVD into your computer's DVD drive. The DVD should go logo-side-up. You can ensure that your computer has a DVD drive (not just a CD drive) by looking for the "DVD" logo on the drive tray. If you don't have a DVD drive, you may not be able to rip your DVD. If your computer doesn't have a DVD drive, you'll need to buy an external one and plug it into one of your computer's USB ports.

steps.title: Open HandBrake.
steps.content: Open HandBrake. Its app icon resembles a pineapple next to a fruity drink.

steps.title: Click the DVD option.
steps.content: Click the DVD option. It's a disc-shaped icon with your DVD's name in the upper-left side of HandBrake. If you don't see the DVD icon, close and then re-open HandBrake.

steps.title: Change the conversion settings if necessary.
steps.content: Change the conversion settings if necessary. HandBrake will typically default to an MP4 conversion, but you should double-check the following aspects before continuing: File format — Make sure the "Container" box has "MP4" in it. If it doesn't, click the box, then click MP4 . File resolution — Click Presets , then click a quality (e.g., 1080p ) on the right side of the window.

steps.title: Click Browse.
steps.content: Click Browse . It's to the right of the "Save As" text box. A pop-up window will appear.

steps.title: Enter your file's save details.
steps.content: Enter your file's save details. Select a save location, enter a file name in the "File name" (Windows) or "Name" (Mac) text box, and click Save .

steps.title: Click Start Encode.
steps.content: Click Start Encode . It's a green button at the top of the HandBrake window. Clicking it will prompt HandBrake to begin converting your DVD into an MP4 file. Once the MP4 has successfully been ripped, you can proceed. On Mac, you'll just click Start here. DVDs can take anywhere from half an hour to several hours to rip into an MP4 file, so make sure your computer is charged and/or plugged in and well-ventilated.

steps.title: Open the MP4 file in VLC.
steps.content: Open the MP4 file in VLC. Open VLC by clicking (or double-clicking) its app icon, then do the following: Click Media (Windows) or File (Mac). Click Convert / Save in the drop-down menu. Click the File tab. Click Add , then select your MP4 and click Open .

steps.title: Click Convert / Save.
steps.content: Click Convert / Save . It's at the bottom of the window.

steps.title: Change the conversion file type to MP3.
steps.content: Change the conversion file type to MP3. Click the "Profile" drop-down box, then scroll down and click Audio - MP3 in the resulting drop-down menu. On Mac, you may instead just check the "Audio" box and make sure that the "Video" box is unchecked.

steps.title: Select a name and save location.
steps.content: Select a name and save location. Click Browse near the bottom of the window, then type in a file name, click the folder in which you want to save your audio file, and click Save .

steps.title: Click Start.
steps.content: Click Start . It's at the bottom of the window. VLC will begin converting your MP4 file into an MP3 file.

steps.title: Force-quit VLC if necessary.
steps.content: Force-quit VLC if necessary. Occasionally, VLC will end up in a loop where it attempts to overwrite your file repeatedly. You can solve this problem by force-quitting VLC: Windows — Press Ctrl + ⇧ Shift + Esc simultaneously, find VLC on the Processes tab, click VLC , and click End task in the bottom-right corner. [8] X Research source Mac — Click the Apple menu , click Force Quit , click the VLC option, click Force Quit , and confirm your decision if prompted. [9] X Research source
